lines: Let’s just get into it! Let’s just get on it— [crosstalk]

lines: [crosstalk] Roll your ball!

lines: —roll that fuckin’ ball!

speaker: Clint
lines: Are we… are we good? Should we just charge right in?

lines: Let’s just do it! We’re about to fight a big fucking robot unicorn and I’m ready!

lines: Yeah, if you want to know the “Previously on…” go back and relisten to the episode!

speaker: Clint
lines: Good point.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Things Remy has done since he got superpowers Jumped into a wall, and then solved a- a riddle from a big St. Peter. Things he has not done Jumped and fought. It’s time. It is now.

lines: I would appreciate, uh, reminding us of what we’re doing.

lines: No, we’re fighting a unicorn and a robot or whatever, let’s goooo!

speaker: Clint
lines: I’ll make it very simple. You’re in a field of lilies of the valley, the- the golden road has kinda fallen into disrepair. Right ahead of you is this thick line of trees. A robot Salome has come in riding on a unicorn. She jumps off the unicorn, she drops John the Baptist’s head— ah, I forgot to put John the Baptist’s head on the—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] No, but let’s just say, Dad—

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] —the map.

speaker: Travis
lines: —your map game is—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] It’s improving! You’re gonna be—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] And I just want to say, I love how you see all the little flowers everywhere, Dad has added some more appropriate, like, fanart versions of us as the icons—

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s no inanimate— there’s no inanimate objects representing living human beings, which is very exciting.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, but then right up there in the top right-hand corner, is—

speaker: Clint
lines: No, no, no, no! Don’t give it away!

speaker: Travis
lines: Wha-

speaker: Justin
lines: What are you talking about, don’t give it away? You’re showing us!

speaker: Travis
lines: [cross talk] It’s there on the— it’s the stuff of nightmares! We’ll get to it, I guess.

speaker: Clint
lines: We’ll get to it. As a matter of fact, it’s coming right now.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, so, I told you the unicorn, this giant robot unicorn, has charged forward after, uh, Ditto challenged me on the biblical authenticity of unicorns.

speaker: Travis
lines: That was in character.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, that was—

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Oh, that’s right.

lines: No, that was me. I didn’t know.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, ok. So this Salome robot starts to dance—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Salome!

speaker: Clint
lines: But it’s really kind of weird. Uh, it’s kind of like, herky-jerky, like somebody doing the robot, which [laughing] I guess is appropriate! Um, but as she dances, as she spins, a couple of the veils that are wrapped around her start to unwind from her body.

speaker: Travis
lines: Gross.

speaker: Clint
lines: Now these are very specific, they are called rumals, and they’re a weapon, they’re weighted at the end. And she spins faster and faster. So the unicorn is charging on you, and just then, you hear this high-pitched buzzing sound coming from the trees, and John the Baptist’s head pops— pipes up, and says

speaker: John the Baptist
lines: Genesis 324, “At the east of the garden of Eden, he stationed the Cherubim and the flaming sword.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh god, they just moved! They moved!

speaker: Clint
lines: Do you need cherubim?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sorry, Dad has chosen the scariest possible sort of iconography for the cherubim on this map, and he—

speaker: Travis
lines: It looks like if weeping angels had babies.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he moved them and it gave me a terrible fright.

speaker: Clint
lines: Three incredibly adorable baby angels—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] No! No!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Wrong. Incorrect.

speaker: Clint
lines: —come flying out of the trees, each with adorable little flaming swords, which I couldn’t find on the icons, so I—

speaker: Travis
lines: Are they like, scale sized the size of like cocktail swords, or a little bit bigger?

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw, that would be awful cute, wouldn’t it?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well these are, these are shaped in the size of real babies, so. And, uh, the unicorn starts making a beeline for Kardala, the cherubim zoom towards Nadiya, and Salome launches her first rumal straight at Remy. So, I would like you—

speaker: Travis
lines: Cherubims! Why did it have to be cherubims?

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, I need you guys to roll to determine who’s going to go first. So what we’ll do is, roll your Fate die, and add your, uh, Athletics bonus to it so I can decide who goes— so we can decide who goes first.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I have, uh, plus five.

speaker: Travis
lines: I rolled a two, plus one, a three.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I’ll, uh, go ahead and add a one, so I got a one.

speaker: Clint
lines: Remy’s going to go first.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I turn to the other two and I say

speaker: Remy
lines: I really don’t want to punch a baby. I know that they’re robots, but it’s still a little bit upsetting.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: She— it’s a robot. I can logically distance myself from the fact that that is not a real baby, Remy, like—

speaker: Remy
lines: Fair enough.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: You get that, right? You fight robot dance lady, I’ll fight robot babies, Kardala?

speaker: Kardala
lines: Yes?

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Robot unicorn. This— I feel like our dance cards are full, as they say.

speaker: Kardala
lines: I do not appreciate your order, but I would like to punch the unicorn.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Remy
lines: I think it’d be a lot easier for you to punch this unicorn if it was lying down.

lines: And I grab the rumal as they’re coming at me, and I want to try to trip the unicorn. Like, they’re long strips of fabric, right? With— with weighted—

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah. But they’re like, this really high-tech mesh—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: —they’ll stretch, but they’re not gonna tear or break.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well I mean if they’re flying at me, I just wanna grab them out of the air and then try to like, uh, clothesline the unicorn as it’s coming, like, get it under the legs and knock it down. Try to interrupt its charge.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What would that be?

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. Well, you tell me, what do you want to use? Tell me, [crosstalk] are you gonna grab the rumal?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] I think— yeah, I think because it’s like a ranged attack and I’m trying to interrupt it, I feel like athletics would be… ‘cause I don’t see anything else, really— maybe Physique, but that’s more like a feat of strength, this is more of a feat of, like, coordination. [crosstalk] Yeah. So…

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] Okay. All right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, that’s not going to be good. So that is a two.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. [crosstalk] And so Salome—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] And you’re rolling— just to be clear, rolled a negative two, plus four…

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Plus four is, yeah, and I don’t think I’m going to add anything to it, cause this is not, uh, “Anything requiring leaping, balancing, or otherwise demonstrating your agility.”

speaker: Clint
lines: I think because of the accuracy of her throw, I think, uh, I think the rumal actually impacts you. [Griffin groans] The weighted part of the rumal hits you—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] I fucking— I see them coming and I, like, clap my hands together and put up like a catcher’s stance, and they just fucking level me.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, yeah! I like that! But you caught it, uh, and you went down. [crosstalk] All right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Okay. I take a— I take a Stress, I imagine.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, you take one Stress.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ok, so we haven’t dealt with this yet. In Fate, um, when you take hits, you have, like, um, so— say you take one point of dam— one point of Stress, is what it’s called.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Basically you have hit points in the form of Stress, and if you take too many of those you get a Consequence, and Consequences are Aspects that Dad can invoke and they can be something like broken rib, or a bloody nose, or concussion, or something like that. And… yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: So you—

speaker: Remy
lines: I got, I got the thing! I got the thing. So don’t worry about that. Disarmed!

speaker: Clint
lines: Who— who’s going next? I’m going to let you pick who goes next.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, that’s right! So this is the best thing, we learned about this in the demo session we did, [Clint Right.] combat order is, you— you pick who goes next, but you, if I just pick, you know, Justin, and then Justin picks Travis, then the enemy gets to go, what, three times in a row, which could be bad.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I feel like Salome would go next.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. Well, I think that, uh, what she does is she, uh, lets go of that, uh, rumal, and, uh, spins again. She’s got another one unwinding. [Griffin Aw, man.] She’s sending it back towards you again.

lines: [crosstalk] Shit, I’m already hurting.

lines: [crosstalk] Um, this time the, uh, the weight at the end of the rumal has a small blade on it.

lines: Aw, that’s mean.

lines: She throws that bladed rumal at you, and she got a negative three.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh.

lines: So combined with that—

lines: [crosstalk] So it accidentally gives you a really great haircut.

speaker: Clint
lines: It goes [laughs] [Griffin Well.] it goes sailing— it goes sailing right over your prone form and maybe snips off a little bit of your hair.

lines: No, no no noooo!

lines: But in a good way! No, but in a good way! [Griffin Ohh!] That’s even better than before.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, fantastic.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m going to have, uh, Nadiya go next.

lines: Great. I’m going to uh, turn my right hand into a whip, and attempt to clip one of, uh, whichever one’s closest to me’s wings.

lines: It would be… this one, right here.

lines: Yeah, the— yeah, okay. You don’t have to— please don’t move it.

lines: It’s very, very upsetting.

lines: Uh, so—

lines: Jesus, what’s with the negative twos? The negative two squad’s here!

lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, well, so, the idea is like, [makes a whipping sound] rrrrpsh! You know, try to clip the, the end of one wing, try to like, shear off, so that it’s like flying all wonky. Um, that’s a will attack. Uh… doot doot doot doot doo… [dissatisfied] Hmm. Now, I want everyone to know, I could make a solid case here for why aerodynamics are science-based, but we don’t have time for that.

lines: Well, is there anything you can do? I mean, you got a bad roll—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, I— I have—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] You can, uh, use one of your Aspects.

lines: Yeah, with human polymer it’s, uh, Will plus two for the attack, so it’s a three.

speaker: Clint
lines: I would say that, that smacks into the cherubim’s left wing, and it starts fluttering in kind of a weird way, so the cherubim kinda— he hasn’t gone down yet, it’s still functioning, but he kind of flies off to the side and flies back a little bit out of the way.

lines: ‘Kay. I’m gonna put down cherubim one, Aspect wonky wing.

lines: Ok. Who goes next, Nadiya?

speaker: Travis
lines: Um, I’m gonna let Kar— no, the u— no, oh god, choices. Unicorn.

lines: Well, the unicorn’s just gonna charge right at Kardala.

lines: Yes! Yes, excellent!

speaker: Clint
lines: Now, it is not using its horn. It’s just gonna use—

lines: It’s using its butt!

lines: It’s just going to use the impact of running into Kardala to drive Kardala back.

lines: So if you’re attacking, then I get to oppose you [Clint Right.] with my fight skill. That is a one, plus—

lines: [crosstalk] The first positives of the game.

lines: Four, that’s a five.

lines: The unicorn also rolled a five.

lines: So on a tie, the attack misses, but the attacker gets a Boost that they can invoke next time, basically.

lines: Okay, so the unicorn goes thundering over the turf, slams into Kardala, but she had had time to brace herself, and doesn’t move.

lines: [crosstalk] All right.

lines: [crosstalk] What is the unicorn’s Boost? It needs like an Aspect that it can invoke next time for free if it wants to. Like “very angry,” or “charging,” or, I guess, I don’t know, it could be anything.

lines: I think that it would, it, maybe it, uh, it now knows a little bit more about Kardala and knows brute force isn’t going to work, how’s that for a Boost?

lines: Yeah.

lines: Um, yeah we can call it Physique, because it— I guess— I wouldn’t necessarily be fighting, technically.

lines: So you got a plus one?

lines: Yes.

lines: [chuckles] Okay. The unicorn has a minus two [Travis Yaaaaay!] So describe it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, so Kardala grabs the horn and, uh… sort of like, spins while grabbing the horn, and just like, rips it off. It is, uh, just obvious, like raw strength. Um, and it is clear she is also enjoying herself very much.

lines: All right. Um—

lines: Why doth thou abideth— Ohhh, god, forget it, that wasn’t the voice. It was more like Charlton Heston. Ah, screw it. Why don’t you leave me alone, you assholes?

lines: Huh?

lines: Uh, hey, Mary? Are you all these robots? Right? Yes?

lines: [In John the Baptist’s voice] I d— [sighs, in a normal voice] Yeah, now shut up.

lines: Okay, can you stop attacking us with all these— we’re here to help, I promise, there’s really no reason—

lines: Noo, are you— No! Continue your assault, ghost!

lines: Riiight, what else would you say?

lines: And the two cherubim that are not, uh, not messed up go flying straight at Kardala. They’re gonna attack—

lines: [crosstalk] Yess! Come to me, babies!

lines: They're gonna— I'm sorry, Nadiya, I apologize.

lines: Dammit.

lines: I'm sorry. They fly right at Nadiya and wield their flaming swords. A plus three overall.

lines: Ahh, Jesus!

lines: Um…? Sooo, that’s a one. I’m gonna invoke Rapid Analytical Mind, um, to give me the opportunity to jump out of the way. How about that? My reflexes are heightened because of my rapid analytical mind.

lines: Okay, I like that.

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait, can you just invoke—

lines: [crosstalk] You wouldn’t just do it.

lines: So, well no, so that would be a plus two, right? So then that would give me three.

lines: Okay.

lines: And the cherubim I think— I said had a two?

lines: Mmhm.

lines: So, describe it.

lines: Um, so the cherubim start heading in and Nadiya begins to form her left hand into a shield, and then realizes it’s not going to finish in time, and processes the information quickly enough to instead kind of just throw herself to the right.

lines: And the flaming swords go whistling through the air and miss Nadiya completely.

lines: So spend a Fate Point, Trav.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

lines: We’re back to Remy.

lines: Alright. I feel like— so the cherubim are still flying up in the air?

lines: Yep.

lines: Okay, I turn to Nadiya and I say,

lines: Hey, can we trade? ‘Cause I feel like I can do pretty good against in the air things.

lines: You got it.

lines: Wait, that’s not her voice at all.

lines: [High pitched] You got it!

lines: [high pitched] You got it, mister!

lines: [In a messed up British accent] Yeah, absolutely! [In a normal voice] Uh, alright.

lines: Can I sell ya a newspaper?

lines: Yes, please, if you’re ready to fight the babies now, and you’re not afraid of robot babies anymore, by all means. I’ll take dance lady, and you can fight the little babies. Sure.

lines: No, the babies are terrible now. I’ve learned a lot about the babies in the last few minutes. I’m not a big fan anymore.

lines: That’s right.

lines: I think I just wanna—

lines: [crosstalk] Well, they can grab things, they can wave…

lines: No, I’ve watched Sesame Street, I know what’s up. I wanna jump up and just try to, uh, just like, I guess punch one of the robot babies in midair. And just kind of [Clint Awwww!] see what happens. They have flaming swords, I dunno— Is there something else I could do? Hm.

speaker: Clint
lines: No!

speaker: Travis
lines: No, punch the babies.

lines: [crosstalk] You haven’t done this—

lines: By all means, punch a baby.

lines: Let’s see it.

lines: Alright, yeah, I’m just gonna do it. And then I imagine there’s some sort of energy around my hand when I go in for this attack, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, yeah, like Iron Fist.

lines: Uh, I don’t know that I need to roll for the jump because my basic super agility lets me jump like two stories high.

lines: Okay.

lines: And, so, let’s just roll for fight.

lines: Let’s hear it for a positive number!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ayy a zero! That ain’t nothing, but I have a three in Fight and a power called Basic Natural Weapon. You have some sort of built-in weaponry which gives you plus two to Fight when brawling unarmed in close quarters. So that’s a five.

speaker: Clint
lines: And you wanna be punching the one that was already kinda beat up?

lines: Nah, I think I’d punch a fresh one, right?

lines: Okay. Punch a fresh one, where do you punch ‘im?

lines: In the baby? It’s not a lot. And it’s— I’m really uncomfortable with how much we’re talking about punching a robot baby.

lines: It's gotta be— what, head? Body? What’re you doing?

lines: I mean body I guess.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, right in the gut. [Justin giggling] And when you do, there’s this gigantic explosion of sparks.

lines: Can I establish something else? ‘Cause we’ve kind of talked about what this power is. I feel like my fists just have the same sort of kinetic power that powers my jumps? And so I feel like the baby would just go blasting off into the sun, almost. Like it would, it’s like I made it jump very very far away when I punched it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, bash it then. Boom!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I think it’s fun to make things explode, but I think it’s very fun to make things go like flying away. Yeah, okay.

lines: It goes flying away, into the woods.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Clint
lines: [singing] Into the woods, into— okay. Alright, so, Salome takes advantage of this situation. She has that other rumal that's been spinning, she has another one that's spinning and when Remy goes sailing past, she throws the rumal in his direction. [Remy Stop hitting me!] Salome’s not trying to hit you with the rumal this time. She throws it to make it wrap around your arms and legs.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, I get to evade this though, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I'm really good at this, so. [rolls] Jesus. PLEASUS. Alright, that’s a minus two but I have plus four and an additional plus two to avoid dodging— to avoid ranged attacks, so, uh, I guess that’s a four total.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, she has a six total.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Beans.

speaker: Clint
lines: The rumal wraps around Remy, pinning his arms to his sides, and pinning his legs so they can’t move. As soon as he comes to the ground, he hits the ground really hard, which kinda stuns him. Salome jumps on the unicorn and, dragging Remy behind her, goes plowing back up into the trees.

lines: [Getting farther away] Byyyeee!

lines: What. is. happening?

lines: Oh, where to start, where to start. Um, you know what? Actually no, just, let’s follow him. I don’t feel like explaining it.

lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, it— Keep up, I’ll explain while we walk. How much do you remember?

lines: Okay, yadda yadda yadda, we don’t actually need to recap the events of the last—

lines: Yes.

lines: Alright.

lines: Ohh my god.

lines: [crosstalk] Okay.

lines: It’s good that this is gonna be such a short arc, because we’re all gonna die.

lines: Oh wait, I have an idea! I shall use… Science! And reprogram one of the cherubim to lead us there!

lines: Okay…

lines: Okay, well that’s a negative two, but my Science is four so I get a two. To cherubim reprogramming.

lines: Oh god.

lines: We now go to…
